thread.title: Brazilian steelmakers forecast decline

author: news.com.au
title: Brazilian steelmakers forecast decline
text:
BRAZIL'S steel production will likely fall 3.4 per cent this year as domestic sales plunge 15.6 per cent, the association representing Brazil's steelmakers says.
THE Brazil Steel Institute report, released during the ExpoA'o international trade fair in Sao Paulo, is consistent with earlier projections that the sector's performance in 2015 will be at roughly the level of 2007.
Brazilian mills will produce 32.8 million tons of steel in 2015, down 3.4 per cent from 2014, while domestic sales will decline 15.6 per cent to 18.3 million tons, the report says. The institute pointed to weakness in the automotive, construction and heavy-machinery sectors, which together account for nearly 80 per cent of domestic demand for steel. Latin America's largest economy grew a mere 0.1 per cent in 2014 and is forecast to contract by at least 1.2 per cent this year amid projected inflation of nine per cent. In the face of the Brazilian economic slump, steelmakers have eliminated 11,200 contractor positions, idled production facilities and suspended planned investment on the order of $US2.1 billion ($A2.84 billion), the institute said.
